meanings.definition: To remove or reduce color from something.
meanings.sent1: She decoloring her hair to make it lighter.
meanings.sent2: The bleach is decoloring the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally decoloring the painting, turning it into a grayscale masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays slowly decoloring the vibrant petals of the flower.
meanings.sent5: The detergent is so powerful that it's decoloring my favorite shirt.

meanings.definition: The process of making something colorless.
meanings.sent1: The decoloring of the water made it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The decoloring agent removed all the stains from the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The magician's decoloring trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The decoloring of the sky as the sun set was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The decoloring process of the photograph preserved it for years to come.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the color of something.
meanings.sent1: The decoloring of the walls transformed the room completely.
meanings.sent2: The decoloring of the leaves signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent3: The decoloring of the hair dye resulted in a surprising new look.
meanings.sent4: The decoloring of the sky from blue to pink was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The decoloring of the fabric created a unique pattern.
